content.div:
Did you forget about Tila Tequila? Yeah, so did we. The 4'11" reality star may not be appearing on any MTV specials these days, but just because her scantily-clad career is dead, doesn't mean that she is -- though the 30-year-old had an extremely close call just days ago.

According to RadarOnline, the petite starlet was released from hospital on Monday after suffering a near-fatal brain aneurysm. Sources tell the outlet she’s feared to have suffered “permanent brain damage” from the ordeal.

"It was terrifying for Tila and death was knocking at her door," a source told RadarOnline. "She was in two hospitals for the span of a week and is still not in perfect health, so she's going to check into an outpatient program."

According to RadarOnline, Tequila suffered an aneurysm in the middle of the night. In pain and thinking irrationally, the outlet reports Tequila subsequently downed two bottles of prescription pills.

"Tila threw up all over her bed after overdosing and felt like she was dying. She was screaming for help, and in desperation, broke her bedroom window and attempted to jump out," the source explained.

"Finally a friend came over after getting a strange text from her and found her convulsing on the bed. He called an ambulance and she was taken to the hospital."

Thankfully, the TV star was hospitalized just in time, and RadarOnline reports that she was laid up for a week. She is still fighting to regain her speech. "It's sad to think she may have some permanent brain damage,” the source told RadarOnline. “She still can't fully speak properly."

mirandaf@dose.ca
